response: the european union has implemented strict guidelines and regulations in protecting the personal information of its citizens. this is known as the general data protection regulation (gdpr). under this regulation, businesses must obtain explicit consent from individuals before collecting and processing their data. consumers have greater control over their data with the right to access, rectification, erasure, and portability. companies that violate these regulations face hefty fines and other legal consequences. it is essential to protect personal information online to ensure privacy and security in a digital world.
